Description: Terracotta figure of Young Pan. Young Pan, modelled in the round, carrying a sheep or a goat upon his shoulders, his hands grasping its feet. Pan is naked, with his hair brushed back and horns rising from his temples; he wears a floral wreath with a rosette in the centre. The rear is summarily worked. Probably hollow; two-piece mould. Micaceous brown Nile silt with a few traces of a white dressing.
Curator's comments: BM Terracotta IV Comparanda. Close, probably same mouldseries: Hilton Price 1897: 400, no. 3314, from the Fayum. Near: Fischer 1994: no. 987, dated probably third century ad. Near, but a youth carrying a bull: Weber 1914: no. 295, from Herakleopolis Magna.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3374)
Condition: Lost below ankle level. Nose damaged.
Acquisition name: Donated by: Rev Greville John Chester
